official-title.#text: To prevent the Internal Revenue Service from unnecessarily seizing protected health information.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: IRS Health Records Privacy Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Limitation in inspection of protected health information

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (as added by this Act), in administering and enforcing the internal revenue laws and the

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , no officer or employee of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may inspect the protected health information of any individual.

text.#text: Except to the extent provided in

quote.#tail: has the meaning given such term in

text.#text: For purposes of this subsection, the term

external-xref.#tail: of title 45, Code of Federal Regulation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be treated as an unauthorized inspection of return information for purposes of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: IRS Health Records Privacy Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and any knowing inspection (or by reason of negligence) in violation of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be treated as an unauthorized inspection of return information for purposes of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: IRS Health Records Privacy Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: Any willful inspection in violation of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: IRS Health Records Privacy Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, as soon as practicable, notify the individual of such inspection.

text.#text: In the case of any inspection of an individual’s protected health information in violation of

header.#text: Limitations on access to protected health information

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text: Limitations on access to protected health information

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such steps as are necessary to minimize inadvertent access or seizure of protected health information.

text.#text: No protected health information may be examined or seized in the execution of a warrant under this section except to the extent such health information directly relates to a criminal violation of the internal revenue laws with respect to which the warrant was issued and is specified therein. In executing any such warrant, the

quote.#tail: has the meaning given such term in

text.#text: For purposes of this subsection, the term

external-xref.#tail: of title 45, Code of Federal Regulation.

text.#text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to warrants executed after the date of the enactment of this Act.
